Detailed Description

This class implements the basic material used to render visuals.

The material uses a d3dx effect as it's basis for rendering operations.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::boolProperty ( bool &  result,
const std::string &  name 
) const

Retrieves value of the first property with the specified name.

This is not the value in the DirectX effect but the Moo::EffectProperty If the property is a integer the value is copied into result.

Parameters:
result The int into which the result will be placed
name The name of the property to read.
Returns:
Returns true if the property’s value was successfully retrieved.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::bumpMapped (  )  const

This method returns the bumped status of the current technique of the effect.

VisualChannelPtr Moo::EffectMaterial::channel (  )  const

This method returns the channel for this material.

If channel is overridden, that is returned first. Otherwise the channel for the current technique is returned.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::commitChanges (  )  const

This method commits state changes on the material's effect to Direct3D.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::hTechnique ( D3DXHANDLE  hTec  ) 

This method sets the current technique and selects the appropriate visual channel for the material.

Parameters:
hTec handle to the technique to use.
Returns:
true if successful

D3DXHANDLE Moo::EffectMaterial::hTechnique (  )  const

This method returns the current technique handle.

If a specific technique has been selected then that will take precedence over the default one. A graphics settings change can change the default technique, but a caller selected technique still overrides that.

bool  addDefault = true 
)

This method loads an EffectMaterial from a DataSection and sets up the tweakables.

StateRecorder * Moo::EffectMaterial::recordPass ( uint32  pass  )  const

This method records all the states for the pass, note that the returned object is only valid until the end of the current rendering loop.

Parameters:
pass the pass to record
Returns:
the recorded states

void Moo::EffectMaterial::replaceDefaults (  ) 

This method finds all shared default properties in the material, and replaces them with instanced properties.

This allows editing of properties without affecting other materials that use the same effect.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::replaceProperty ( const std::string &  name,
EffectPropertyPtr  effectProperty 
)

This function replaces an existing effect property with the one given.

Parameters:
name The name of the property to replace.
effectProperty SmartPointer to the property to replace the existing.
Returns:
Returns true if the replace succeeded.

void Moo::EffectMaterial::save ( DataSectionPtr  pSection  ) 

This method saves the given material's tweakable properties to the given datasection.

Material saving does not support recursion / inherited properties.

Parameters:
m The material to save
pSection The data section to save to.
Returns:
Success or Failure.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::skinned (  )  const

This method returns the skinned status of the current technique of the effect.

bool Moo::EffectMaterial::vectorProperty ( Vector4 &  result,
const std::string &  name 
) const

Retrieves value of the first property with the specified name.

This is not the value in the DirectX effect but the Moo::EffectProperty If the property is a vector the value is copied into result.

Parameters:
result The vector in which the result will be placed
name The name of the property to read.
Returns:
Returns true if the property’s value was successfully retrieved.
